Statistical Overview: Should Elneny be a regular in the Arsenal XI?

https://www.kingfut.com/2018/03/30/should-mohamed-elneny-start-arsenal/

Petr Cech reveals disappointment at Arsenal's season but claims they are not 30 points worse than Man City

Petr Cech has revealed his disappointment with Arsenal this season as they sit 33 points off Manchester City in sixth.

However the keeper also moved to deny the table reflects the difference in quality between the two sides, insisting they are closer than the league suggests.

Arsenal also trail Tottenham and a Champions League place by 13 points and any hopes of a return to Europe's elite competition looked hinged on the Europa League.

'Especially last year, that was a big disappointment because this is a club that should be in the Champions League and that should not miss Champions League football and obviously had not missed it for 21 years,' Cech told BBC's Premier League show.

'The most disappointing thing is if you look at our home form we are right there with the best of teams.

'If you look at our away form, it was terrible.'

Arsenal have won just three of their 15 league games on the road this season, losing eight of them and Cech understands the fans frustration.

The 35-year-old refused to single anyone out for blame in their poor run and believes the gap in quality to Man City is not the 30 points the table suggests.

'I don’t believe our qualities and Manchester City’s qualities are 30 points apart. We haven’t played well enough to keep up with them and obviously it’s our fault.

'I understand the frustration and I understand when it goes on for more than ten years and so many times you are close, and you don’t jump the last hurdle, it’s obviously disappointing.'

Arsenal not prepared to break the bank to keep Jack Wilshere on new contract

Arsenal fear Jack Wilshere will reject their offer of a new contract and leave on a free transfer in the summer. Arsène Wenger has previously suggested the club have made him a take-it-or-leave-it offer and, at the moment, it looks as though the midfielder will do the latter. Everton, West Ham and Juventus have been linked with a move for the 26-year-old.

https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/mar/30/arsenal-jack-wilshere-contract
